basics.name: Sean Gao
basics.summary: Senior Analyst @ Deloitte | Machine Learning | Fintech | CFA all levels passed

projects.name: Small Language Model
highlights: Built a character-level multi-head transformer-based language model from scratch, featuring 25.28M parameters
Embedding dimension: 512; Number of heads: 8; Head size: 64; Number of hidden layers: 8
Designed to autocomplete text given a prompt
Stack: PyTorch, Neural Network, Object-Oriented Programming, Natural Language Processing

projects.name: Stock price forecasting with LSTM model
highlights: Developing a framework for training a LSTM model to predict the closing stock price for IBM based on a variety of macro and micro economic factors, including GDP, various commodity prices, and indexes like NASDAQ and S&P500
Adopting statistical metrics to assess the performance of the models and selected a champion model

projects.name: Full Stack Web Development (takes ~ 1 min for server to load)
highlights: Developed a full-stack web application using Node.js, Express, MongoDB, and React. Implemented RESTful APIs with JSON request handling, modular routing, and frontend routing with Chakra UI components.

work.name: Fairstone Bank
highlights: Improved the efficiency of risk rating for 1M+ clients by developing and testing GBM models and other machine learning algorithms, leveraging scikit-learn, PyTorch and other major Python Libraries.
Automated data preparation, cleansing and sanity check by constructing a data pipeline using Python, SQL and Alteryx tools.
Conducted feature importance analysis using Shapley Values based upon a Gradient Boosting Model.

Handled end-to-end project processes including data exploration, segmentation using decision trees, variable reduction, model development with Altair Knowledge Studio, stability/accuracy check, validation, and documentation.
Collaborated with cross-functional teams to generate and implement models, ensuring understanding of data semantics and usage.

work.name: Weathsimple
highlights: Worked on an instant deposit model (Light Gradient-Boosting) that expedites money transaction for over 2 million clients
Created structured SQL queries to build a pipeline with AWS Redshift, used for data extraction, transforming and loading
Used Python and Apache Airflow to streamline credit risk analysis, feature selection, and trained major classification models
Regularly met with stakeholders to provide updates and taking on new demands
Increased the amount of instant deposit by 7% for basic users and 14% for prime users; Increased monthly revenue by $70,000/client

education.area: Mathematics, minor in Computer Science, Data Science

awards.title: 25th Anniversary Scholarship in Mathematics and Statistics
awards.awarder: Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Calgary
highlights: Offered annually to continuing undergraduate students in the Department of Mathematics and Statistics
One award offered in each of: Pure Math, Applied Math, and Statistics
Academic merit.
